results.title: Behind the mountain
results.brief_description: This collaborative video installation presents floor projections in randomly scattered blank cardboard boxes, encased within the borders of each the image of a moving figure of a mixed Aboriginal demographic, confined and enclosed in the space through the image size. The viewer moves in amongst and interacts with these images, their shadow visible over the image as they lean to look into each box. The figures within, dancers filmed from the Bangarra Dance Company, contort and rotate in the limits of the space, pulling inwards and pushing outwards, visually and spatially engaging in the historical and contemporary forces which construct and confine the Aboriginal body. In interaction with these images the use of a surround sound composite creates an aural journey that evokes pulsing electrical currents in a storage space, interrupted sporadically by the sound of tearing packing tape and a strong bass sound from below each box which creates a sensorial engagement with the movement in the images within.

results.title: Behind the mosquito net = Dibalik kelambu
results.creator_credit: Sukma Putra Film, M Sukmajaya and Teguh Karya
results.brief_description: This film is one of a string of romantic melodramas involving three of the most influential people in the Indonesian film industry. Director Teguh Karya teamed Christine Hakim and Slamet Rahardjo (who were then both members of Teguh’s theatre group, ‘Teater Populer’) as husband and wife, Hasan and Lela. Hasan, unable to meet the expectations of his father-in-law whom the married couple is staying with, is fast losing his self-esteem. Forced to work as a taxi driver after losing his job, he develops an ambiguous relationship with another woman when the situation at home becomes intolerable. Winner of 6 Citra Awards at the 1983 FFI. Music by Eros Djarot, screenwriter Slamet Rahardjo. Cast includes Christine Hakim, Slamet Rahardjo and Nungky Kusumastuti. In Indonesion with English subtitles, which are sometimes difficult to read.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A warning against unsanitary conditions in restaurants, and a demonstration of precautions that should be taken against dirt and harmful bacteria in the handling of food. Suggestions are made for increasing efficiency through better food storage, dishwashing methods and staff facilities. Measures taken by public health authorities to maintain standards in restaurants.

results.title: Behind the mask
results.creator_credit: Kim Farrant, Kate Riedl and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Behind the Mask reveals the complex emotions and identities of a group of young Melbourne primary school students. The ancient art of mask making provides a dramatic ritual which acts as a catalyst for self expression, revealing deep rooted feelings and thoughts, not usually associated with 10 and 11 year olds. By creating their own masks and performing with it in front of their peers and parents, the children find a voice to express the complex emotions and concerns that effect their lives. An extremely powerful and revealing program about children’s experience of life.

results.title: Behind the flyways
results.creator_credit: United States. Fisheries and Wildlife Service and Rex Gary Schmidt
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how data is gathered on the North American continent for use in making water-fowl regulations. Depicts all types of water-fowl hunting. Shows biologists and other personnel making field studies from Mexico to the Arctic on land, water and in the air. Explains how the information obtained is used in developing regulations.

results.brief_description: Wirth’s circus comes to town! The arrival of the circus at Melbourne and their preparations for a performance. Suitable for children 6+ years old.

results.title: Behind the airline
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews, Qantas Empire Airways, H.G. Guinness and Frank Coffey
results.brief_description: December 1953 was the 50th anniversary of heavier than air flight. This film compares the early flights by the Wright Brothers in America and W.E. Hart in Australia, with the highly complex organization of a modern international airline in Australia. The film illustrates the many activities of airline personnel, all of whom play their part in keeping aircraft in the air. Commentary by Harry Dearth, photography by Syd Wood.

results.title: Behavioural biology
results.creator_credit: Coronet Films and Bruce J. Russell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Looks at behaviour patterns and their relationship to brain and nerve cell circuits. Shows that behaviour can be both inherited and adaptive by examining simple forms of behaviour in single celled organisms. Also presents an inquiry that culminates in an open-ended analysis of some aspects of human behaviour.
